And what does a tavern bouncer know of a lady's behavior? I do not flirt, as you so crudely put it; I merely enliven this company with my wit, humor and words!
Try for a little dignity and decorum, won't you?
Women do not belong on the field of battle.
Don't you go telling me what a woman can and cannot do on a battlefield.
Just because you wield a ludicrous weapon with an even more ridiculous name does not make you a warrior in my eyes.
You bumptious piece of dung.
One of our Singalian Temptresses would kill you in the blink of an eye.
I can fight as well as any man! I'll demonstrate if you like.
I've had it with your arbitrary and unauthorized orders, Donavan, you sadistic, petty little martinet.
Drinking makes you even grumpier than you normally are when sober. Why don't you just shut the hell up?
Next time you start handing me your guff, I'll hand you something more lethal than an order in return!
If I want your opinion, I'll ask for it. Don't hold your breath while you wait.
Do tell me, Ssir Roland, ssince you desserted your Order, why does the sstench of ssanctimony still pervade your vicinity?
You, Madam Alyssa, are the embodiment of all I loathe. Your very voice makes my skin crawl.
Ssuch passion for one ssworn to virtue!
Were it not for our Captain, I'd have killed you long since, for your own sins and those of your cult.
How uncharitably murderouss you are!
Approach me not again, or your life is at risk.
Adonja, would you tell me of some of the Mystmountain clans' traditions and history? I know nothing about your people and would like to learn of them.
I am flattered at your interest in the Mystmountain clans, Ansen, and would be most pleased to tell you of them. We have some interesting battle chants and epic poems.

I've no mind to see you go, Leslie, but you're not cut out for life in a mercenary company. One of these days, I'd like to take you away with me, maybe start a merchanting company of our own. What say you to that?
You are kind to think of me, Diev, and I will consider your words, in the event we both survive this endless fighting. I am honored by your offer.
Ah, Riva Bibi, I would carry you off to my people did I not fear awakening after a night of passion only to find my throat slit! I joy in fighting beside you!
I thank you, Kassim, and I greatly enjoy battle when you are at my side! We make rather an effective team, I think.

Based on our last battle, Leth, we've much to learn from you Noldor in terms of battle technique. Thanks for covering my back. Show me that counter-move you used on the fellow trying to take me from behind, would you?

You, my dear, are as lovely as you are lethal, and you appeal to me on the basis of both. I would be pleased to show you that counterstrike. Is there anything else you'd like me to demonstrate to you, hmm?
Madam, with the exception of your habit of gelding your male slaves, I must say I approve of your island's customs, particularly that of training your women in warrior skills.
I thank you, Sir Jocelyn. Pity you're a man, or you would have made a fine commander.
It is good to see women so highly trained in battle as yourself. Pendor would do well to follow that one, at least, of your customs.
I am unused to accepting praise from those of your sex, but I appreciate your praise of my fighting skills.
I am sure that you at least, my dear Alyssa, can appreciate the deplorable lack of decent food in Pendor.  What do your snakeish confreres serve at feasts? Not roasted reptile, one assumes?
Roassted reptile?! Certainly not! We prefer organically-grown vegetarian fare in the Sserpent Temple. We never eat meat; the very thought of doing sso is revolting.

I fondly recall my father's feasts. He had an exceptionally skilled torturer, who could keep a victim shrieking throughout several dozen courses. From the peacock tongues through the chine of beef, their screams were quite stimulating to the appetite.
I find the concept of torture during dinner parties mosst intriguing, I musst ssay.
Ediz, I did not realize that your people had such an admirable code of honor, and I am impressed by your determination to recover your own lost honor in battle. That is the way of a true knight.
I admire your fighting skills, Sir Rayne, and were you not an outlander, would welcome you into my clan as a brother.
Frederick, you are a man after my own heart! Obviously, Mettenheim breeds strong, disciplined warriors who understand how to hold the line in battle.
You, Donavan, have a clear understanding of the disciplines of battle. Were you in Mettenheim, in a few years you might qualify for recruitment into the Forlorn Hope.
Sara, what say we adjourn to my tent for awhile? I'd like a private sample of your bardic skills!
Mmm, my dear Siggy, I had no idea you were so interested in my bardic talents!
Heh, Heh, 'Fox' is the right name for you, my girl!
Let us indeed adjourn to your tent at our first opportunity. I have some special skills which you may enjoy!
I wonder why my luck turned so bad, just as I was setting up as a merchant. Don't seem fair that I should be caught by the Vanskerries before ever I sold a single bit of my merchandise.
Kaverra, lass, it is likely that what befell you was a trial sent you by the gods, to test your mettle.
I still have nightmares about those Vanskerries and what they did.
Astraea would welcome you, I am sure, as she would welcome any warrior who is brave and true. You have triumphed over your adversity bravely.
I look forward to slitting you open in search of hidden treasure.

All you fools want is to kill, kill, kill! Where is the point in fighting over a village burnt to the ground with nothing left but ravaged fields and dead peasants?  You should die for your own stupidity.
All you fools can think of is death and dismemberment! Does no one in Pendor ever consider compromise or a parley?!
Retreat now, while you have the chance.
Die, you ferengi camel-lovers! My blade hungers to bathe in your blood!
Hah, you don't know what trouble you just walked into! This will be fun! Let's have at it!
Scum of your ilk does not merit an honorable death in battle, but we generously grant you that. Be grateful, maggots, as we slaughter you.
Your threats are puerile, and you are simply stalling in a futile attempt to postpone your death. Stop blathering and fight; your verbal saber-rattlings bore me.
Hah! We kill better men than you before we stop for breakfast in the morning. I'm hungry; hurry up and let's finish this!
Start praying, you bastards, and hope your gods are ready to receive you.
Hah! You will need to put up a better show than that to impress me.
The vultures shall feast on your carcasses tonight!
This incident will make a most amusing ballad. Pity you will never live to hear it!
I look forward to cutting you down as you flee.
Go back to whatever whorehouse you were born in, or we'll send you to hell in a heartbeat!
Yess, let uss kill them all and sshow no mercy! They merit nothing more. Let the bloodletting begin!
Come forth and be slain by our swords of righteousness. None of you will live to see the morrow!
We're gonna kill every one of you bastids.
You worthless bastards best flee while you can. I'm coming after you!
When I'm done with you, you'll beg for death!
Ansen has a certain puppyish charm and I think he has a crush on me. I find him rather sweet, even though he's far from a clan ideal. I never thought to fancy a man who could read.

If ever we cease this fighting, Captain, I may stay on in Pendor to trade. Those towns and villages not ravaged by war would make excellent trade routes for the right merchant, who knows where to buy and sell. Diev and I might make good trading partners if events work out in our favor.
I have all the men patched up again, Captain. We'll need to rest for a bit before they are fit to fight again, however. How about camping for an extra day when next we stop?
I never thought I'd grow to like a D'Shar, but Kassim is well-born and a noble soul. He is an excellent addition to the troop, Captain.

I am reminded of some lines from Khushal Khan Khattack, a famous D'Shar poet - 'the boy across the river has buttocks like a ripe peach, but alas, I cannot swim.'  It must be all those fresh-faced peasants in the field over there which brought it to mind.
Captain, you know I stand ready to remove any annoyance for you, particularly in our company, if you take my meaning. I know just where I'd like to start.

Sir Alistair is evil beyond all hope of redemption. His presence in this company sullies our honor, and I implore you to sack him posthaste. I feel filthy just being in his presence. There is also the matter between us of his having been despatched by his Order to kill me. I have no doubt he will attempt to do so at his first opportunity.

As per the Feudal Times and Reactionary Herald, the Pendor Lords know about as much about fief management as a three-year-old. One of them erected a gallows outside his village gates, to discourage banditry. Thus far, only his villagers have danced upon it, mostly for causing him petty annoyance. I'll grant you that is amusing,  but it is wasteful when carried to excess. If he persists, he'll soon run-out of peasants to oppress.

That Veccavian woman wants a sharp lesson in common courtesy, if you want my opinion. She had the audacity to refer to me in most discourteous terms, and makes fun of my knightly honor behind my back. Were it not against my code to fight a woman, I'd teach her that lesson, I can tell you.

I dread the day we fight the Snake Cult and my father turns up in the battle. Should that happen, Captain, I don't want it to be my hand which slays him. I have enough of my kin's blood on my hands as it is.

Verdammnis der Holle! Mein General, the lack of military Disziplin in this... this... Gesindel! is appalling! Mein General, you must force them to behave like proper soldiers, because right now, they behave like the Gesindel they are!
If there were more like such as Sir Rayne in this company, I would be pleased. You should exercise more sense in the way you choose to hire, eliminating those with no fighting skills and less honor.

Captain, I vow and declare that if any other member of this troop decides to read me a lecture on morality, I shall reach for my blade. I weary of holier-than-thou speeches from those incapable of anything else!

When you said your lot could use a little discipline and training, I thought I could help you. If you don't back up my authority when I give them an order, this troop will remain an undisciplined rabble!

Whenever I think our cause is hopeless, Captain, I think about people like Leslie. She and those like her are the ones who need defending, the decent, honest folk who just want to make a living free of fear and tyranny. She gives me hope.
You are too ssoft-hearted to be a proper commander. Why cater to these worthless peasantss you coddle by doing their bidding? SSack the villagess and take what you need, I ssay!

Captain, I know you sometimes despair at the task before you, and wonder if you can succeed. Keep a stout heart. Even in this evil world, good must ultimately triumph over evil. You must never give up the fight.
Captain, how's about we chase down a few more of those Vanskerry bastards? I don't have my fill of killing them yet. Don't know as I ever will, but I can try!
I can smell the new-turned earth in the fields of that village over there. Can't believe I miss plowing, but there it is: the scent makes me a wee bit homesick.

When I regain the throne of Veccavi, I think I shall have to return to Pendor and impose some sensible order on this unruly society. I cannot believe they allow their men to run about ungelded and actually permit them to assume superior roles. Pendor would function much better if this situation could be corrected.
He speaks to you politely now, but once you do what he wants, he'll change his tune.
Captain, remember that the first offer is only that - the opening bid. See what else is on offer before you close any bargains!
Look at that red nose and potbelly, Captain! This one likes his wine and food far more than battle, I'd guess, and he probably has the gout. Looks like he has head lice, too.
Captain, you should listen to this lord. One of his superior rank should be accorded respect and obedience.
Captain, this one is nothing and unfit for you, or indeed our troop, to follow.
Captain, I could have him out of the way in a jiffy, with none the wiser as to how it happened. Just say the word.
This request is quite reasonable and honorable. I urge you to comply with my Lord's wishes.
I cannot comprehend this fellow's objection to a few dead peasants, unless perhaps their taxes are in arrears or he has exhausted the village's supply of nubile virgins.
Be ever wary of Lords and their plots and schemes, Captain. Many come to grief through agreeing to follow a lord.
Captain, if we run about at the beck and call of lords, the gods only know what trouble we'll fall into! You'd do better to take them prisoner and make them dance to your own tune!
These Pendor lords appear always to put their own petty aims ahead of the prosperity of their fiefs. I do not understand such stupidity.
Amongst the Singalians, we have no lords. We killed the last one over a hundred years ago.
I have spent much time in the courts of Pendor. Do try, my Captain, for behavior appropriate to such a court. Discourtesy to a lord is never wise.
His ambition likely exceeds the capacity of his purse. Demand an advance payment and see what he says. My guess is that he'll bluster but not come up with the gold.
You can always trust a lord to be a lord - be wary!
Thiss lord is a fool! I would ignore him if I were you. He iss far too sstupid to take sseriously!
It may be that this man speaks the truth, Captain, though I rather doubt it. Be careful what you promise him.
Hmph, if I were you, Captain, I'd pay no mind to this 'un. Lords is nuthin' but liars, that's what my granfer allus said.
Another lord asking yet another favor. Don't you get tired of catering to their whims? I certainly do.
These pathetic excuses for Pendor lords are as moronic as they are pretentious. Give this fool short shrift - you have no need of him.
I hope you come with good intentions. Then we can speak further.
You look hardened by war and if you are hardened, all that fighting can lead to more than just scrapes and petty loot.
You show promise, and under my tutelage you might become more than a thug.
You have the look of someone with strong will but of no purpose. I can give you that purpose.
Unlike some of my peers, I am not at all above making use of the odd stranger.
A stranger may have hidden motivations, but those motivations just might coincide with my own.
I welcome you, if you support the cause of the D'Shar.
It may be that your presence here could be of use to me.
This is no fat land for a politician such as meself. The people are simple, the loyalties are written in stone. An outsider such as yourself though, well, you could change the game.
They say that a stranger might prove useful in strange times -- let's hear what you've got to say.
Dear friend, what a seldom honor to be in your presence.
What an honor! I know about your many triumphs and consider you my tutor in the art of war.
My friend, what a joy to have you near. My men were cheering as they saw you heading towards us.
I am honored to bask in the light of your presence.
While you may aspire to citizenship in the Empire, it is rarely granted to those such as you. I'd advise you go elsewhere.
By the by, here's a friendly bit of advice: should you see the Noldor - run, don't walk!
Greetings, stranger. State your business here.
I shall permit you to travel across my territory in peace, but raid my villages or harm my tribesmen and I shall kill you!
We meet here to plan the destruction of our enemies. But still, one must pray for their immortal souls.
Well met, friend. Pass in peace and my men will not accost you.
With that arrogance, you just be glad my weapon is sheathed! Now say what you want and leave the area.
You may be a skilled warrior, and if I could be sure that only our enemies feared you, I would say Willkommen.
The fact that you do not hold a weapon in your hand shows your recklessness -- and how easily I could crush you.
My scouts informed me you were coming, but I took no precautions, seeing as it is only you.
In the Empire, transgressions by strangers are not taken lightly. I'd advise you heed my advice while you're here.
Hail. Who crosses my lands without my permission?
If it is trouble you seek in D'Shar lands, I think you have found it.
We D'Shar do not take lightly encroachments into our territory.
Ah, these walls inspire me. I would rather meet an enemy here than a friend!
State your business quickly or stand aside!
I see you have some bruises from battle. If I cared for your well-being, I'd have my surgeon look at you -- but I don't.
Yes, what is it? Speak fast before I have my men use you for target practice.
You look weary from your journeys and could use a drink, I suspect. There's a lake near here. You're welcome.
Please, no more challenges today! I squash people like you as easily as flies.
As long as you're here, why not go and fight the Snake cult? At least then you'd be of some use to the Empire.
If you're here as a spy for those damned D'Shar savages, I shall kill you where you stand.
You may have heard that I impale those who rob or raid in my territory. Keep that in mind.
What, precisely, do you seek here?
Ah, you missed the hunt this morning. I rode out on my finest steed with my finest dogs. Would you believe it, though? The girl got away!
I suppose you found me by following the trail of burning villages, eh? Well, my men were cold.
So, you are the one roaming the countryside like a thug. Can you speak?
I heard about your last battle and I'm surprised to see you standing without support.
The stables are over there. And while you're at it, muck out my jakes as well.
My time is precious. When you arise in the morning, I've already eaten a hearty meal and trained my men, so be brief.
Should you elect to cause trouble in the Empire, our Legionnaires will see to your punishment -- promptly.
You look brave enough now. I wonder how you'll look when the Snake cult and the Noldor have done with you.
And who are you, who enters my hall uninvited?
I trust you have an excellent excuse for your presence here?
I've grown weary. Even abusing the servants fails to cheer me.
I suppose you've come to beg help like any other refugee?
I have killed many boars! In comparison, you are weak and cannot run as fast.
They say I kill for fun, but do you hear me laughing?
You are not one to be trusted and I am not one to be tricked. State your errand and begone.
Maybe we'll meet in a tournament someday. I do more harm with blunt weapons than you'd care to know.
We of the Empire have a low tolerance for listening to riffraff. State your business and leave.
You have my leave to depart the Empire. We don't want your kind polluting our land.
If you spy here for the Empire, your life will be very short.
Why do you trespass in D'Shar territory?
It reminds me of how far we've slipped towards barbarism, when I see the likes of you addressing a lord.
Don't waste my time, peasant! If I felt the need of useless talk, my wife would be beside me.
May Thallo ver Shures follow you and bring beauty and life wherever you go.
You look healthy, my friend, and have many teeth left!
Welcome, dear ally. What say you?
I see your health is strong and your eyes have fervor. Speak freely.
I'll not go so far as to say your presence here is entirely welcome, but do no harm in my territory and I'll do none to you.
I've more of a predilection for peace than war, but that does not mean I will tolerate any incursions into my territory.
As a lord of the D'Shar, I bid you welcome.
We of the D'Shar treat our guests well -- when they do not bring harm to our people.
Conclaves of war are not my usual pastime, I must admit. Ah, I wish we could get more ale in here.
Well met, the ride here is lonely, eh? Have ye time to stop and share a wee dram?
I am told that you are pledged to one of the pretenders who disputes my claim to the crown of Pendor - but we may still talk.
Your fame runs before you! Perhaps it is time that you sought a liege worthy of your valor.
Your fame runs before you! Perhaps we shall test each other's valor in a tournament, or on the battlefield!
I've heard of you. Well, I'm not one for bandying words, so if you have anything to say, out with it.
I know your name. It strikes fear in men's hearts. That is good. Perhaps we should speak together, some time.
Ah, yes. At last we meet. You sound like a good {reg63?man:woman} to know. Let us speak together, from time to time.
I know your name -- and from what I hear, I'll warrant that many a grieving widow knows too. But that is no concern of mine.
I've heard of you! It's very good to finally make your acquaintance.
I know your name. They say you are a most valiant warrior. I can only hope that your honor and mercy matches your valor.

I see that you carry a {reg63?nobleman's:noble's} banner, although I do not recognize the device. Know that I am always looking for good {reg63?men:warriors} to fight for me, once they prove themselves to be worthy of my trust.
I see that you carry a nobleman's banner, but I do not recognize the device. No matter -- a brave {reg63?man's:warrior's} home is all the world, or so they say!
I don't recognize the device on your banner. No doubt another foreigner come to our lands, as if we didn't have so many here already.
I see that you carry a nobleman's banner, but I do not recognize the device. Another vulture come to grow fat on the leftovers of war, no doubt!

I see that you carry a nobleman's banner, but I do not recognize the device. Still, it is always worthwhile to make the acquaintance of {reg63?men:women} who may one day prove themselves to be great warriors.
I see that you carry a nobleman's banner, but I do not recognize the device. Perhaps you are the bastard {reg63?son:daughter} of a puffed-up cattle thief? Or perhaps you stole it?
I see that you carry a nobleman's banner, but I do not recognize the device. Please forgive my ignorance! It is good to make your acquaintance.

I see that you carry a nobleman's banner, but I do not recognize the device. No doubt you have come to Pendor in search of wealth and glory. If this indeed is the case, then I only ask that you show mercy to those poor souls caught in the path of war.
You may be of common birth, but know that I am always looking for good men to fight for me, if they can prove themselves to be worthy of my trust.
Perhaps you are not of gentle birth, but even a commoner, be {reg63?he:she} of sufficient valor, may make something of {reg63?himself:herself} some day.
Speak quickly, if you have anything to say, for I have no time to be bandying words with common soldiers of fortune.
You have the look of a mercenary, another vulture come to grow fat on the misery of this land.
Well... I have not heard of you, but you have the look of a {reg63?man:woman} who might make something of {reg63?himself:herself}, some day.
Normally I cut the throats of impudent commoners who barge into my presence uninvited, but I am in a good mood today.
Well, you look like a good enough sort.
Peace to you, and always remember to temper your valor with mercy, your courage with honor.
I have heard much about you. Some men may fear a woman who is versed in the art of war, but I will not scorn one who can wield a sword, should she be brave and loyal.

I have heard much about you. They say that you are the equal of even the bravest of men in your prowess at arms. Perhaps one day I shall try my valor against yours, either in a tournament or on the battlefield!
I've heard of talk of you -- the woman who fights like a man - and thinks like one.
I know your name. It strikes fear in men's hearts. That is good. Perhaps we should speak together, some time.
Ah, yes. At last we meet. You sound like a good woman to know. Let us speak together, from time to time.
I know your name -- and from what I hear, I'll warrant that many a grieving widow knows too. But that is no concern of mine.
I've heard of you! It's very good to finally make your acquaintance.
I know your name. They say you are a most valiant warrior. I can only hope that your honor and mercy matches your valor.
It is not often that I meet a woman who leads men into battle. But these are dark and troubled times, and I will not scorn one who can wield a sword, should she be brave and loyal.
I do not recognize the device on your banner, but clearly you are a lady of rank. Please consider me your most humble servant.
I don't recognize the device on that banner. Clearly another foreigner come to our lands, bringing their strange ways.

I see that you carry a noble's banner, but I do not recognize the device... You should know, lady, that in Pendor it is the men who ride to war, and if you seek to overturn the natural order of things, you will find your fair head stuck on a pike - like any other rebel!
It is not unheard-of for a woman to seek her fortune on the battlefields of Pendor, but neither is it usual. I shall be most interested in your progress.
You appear to be of noble rank, but I don't recognize your banner. Clearly, another foreigner come to our shores -- no doubt from a land where men are weak, and the women ride to war in their place!
I see that you carry a nobleman's banner, but I do not recognize the device. Forgive my ignorance, my lady! It is good to make your acquaintance.

It is not every day that we see a woman caparisoned for war. Please do not take this amiss, my lady, for you have every right to protect yourself, but I cannot pretend to be fully comfortable with your decision to fight in battle. I would prefer that women be untouched by these wars, as I believe the female to be the custodian of what little gentility and tenderness remains to us.
It is not often that I meet a woman who aspires to lead men into battle. But these are dark and troubled times, and I shall not scorn one who can wield a sword, should she be brave and loyal.

Greetings, my lady. Although I see from your demeanor that you are a warrior woman, not a conventional maiden, I hope that you are not averse to a declaration of admiration from me, your most humble servant.
Hah. Fancy this - a lady equipped for war. Well, it's a strange sight, but in your case, I can imagine that it might grow on me.
It is unusual to see a woman girded for war. Be careful, my lady - it is a harsh world, and it would be a shame to see such beauty marred by a sword-blow.

Greetings, my lady. Please do not think it forward, if I say that it is unusual to see a woman caparisoned for war. I hope that one day I may be the father of a daughter possessed of such bravery and spirit.
What have we here! A woman, caparisoned for war! Well, I dare say that one as fair as you could lend a touch of femininity even to a mail hauberk.
My lady, if you are skilled as arms as you are fair in countenance, then your enemies should indeed fear you!
Greetings, my lady. Even with the dust of the march upon your clothes and gear, I can see that you are not lacking in the graces of your noble sex.

It is not often that I meet a woman who aspires to lead men into battle. But these are dark and troubled times, and I for one will not turn away hands that can grip a sword, should their owner be brave and loyal.
I suggest, my lady, that you take care how you ride about this dangerous land. If you ever wished to seek a more... em... settled life, I'm sure I could find you a worthy husband from amongst my men.
By the way, girl -- does your husband know that you nicked his weapons and armor? I'll bet you're in for a right old beating when you get home!
These are fallen times indeed, when even women turn brigand, to pick the leavings from the wreckage of war.
It is not unheard-of for a woman to seek her fortune on the battlefields of Pendor, but neither is it usual. I shall be most interested in your progress.
A woman, caparisoned for war! Well, I suppose that you're no more womanly than most of those in my service who call themselves warriors.
From the look of you, I suppose you can handle yourself, but do be careful out there, my lady.

It is not every day that we see a woman caparisoned for war. Please do not take this amiss, my lady, for you have every right to protect yourself, but I cannot pretend to be fully comfortable with your decision to fight in battle. I would prefer that women be untouched by these wars, as I believe the female to be the custodian of what little gentility and tenderness remains to us.
I won my weapons in battle. Care to test their - and my - mettle?
Never mind my country. Here in Pendor, overtly drooling cretins lead men to war.
And you, sir, have manners as polished as any Jatu.
Your words come from your arse - try using your mouth for a change.
These are parlous times, when ill-mannered idiots call themselves 'Lord'.
Perhaps now I'll take your banner, your castle - and your life.
I'd be delighted to rearrange your face into a more pleasing visage, sir.
Would you care to experience the tenderness of my steel?
Would you care to experience the tenderness of my steel?
How dare you? I don't go fishing in the jakes.
If you had on a horse's harness, I'd be hard put to tell your face from your arse.
If you're disturbed by the sight of me, I'd be pleased to put out your eyes.
You raided peasants under my protection in the village of {s51}. I shall punish you for your insolence if you do it again!
You dared to raid {s51}, destroying my property and killing my peasants. Now it is your turn to pay the price - in blood!
You raided my village at {s51}, stealing my property and killing my peasants. I will make you pay dearly for disrupting my revenues, you filthy marauder!
You have raided the hamlet of {s51}, ravaging my lands and murdering my peasants. You will pay a steep price for your crimes!
Refugees reported you sacked {s51}. I'll teach you to raid my village, you foreign marauder.
You have been raiding {s51}, which I hold by inherited right. Your actions place a grave strain on our relationship, my friend.
You plundered and wrecked {s51}, burning homes and taking what little my peasants had. Do it again, and we'll come to blows.
I have heard that you have stolen cattle from innocent farmers under my protection in the village of {s51}. I will punish you for your misdeeds!
I have heard that you have stolen cattle from my villagers living at {s51}. You will pay for this dishonorable act!
I have heard that you have stolen cattle from my villagers living at {s51}. I will make you think twice before you disrupt my revenues like that again.
I have heard that you have stolen cattle from my villagers living at {s51}. You will pay for this dishonorable act!
I have heard that you have stolen cattle from my villagers living at {s51}. Do it again and I'll gut you like a fish.
I have heard that you have stolen cattle from my villagers living at {s51}. This will place a grave strain on our friendship.
I have heard that you have stolen cattle from my villagers living at {s51}. If you continue to behave this way, we may soon come to blows.
You burned my village, {s51}, and stole from my peasants. I consider your acts a personal affront.
You common bandit, did you rob my peasants at {s51} for the fun of it? I will punish you for your misdeeds!

I heard that you stole food from my peasants at {s51}. Well, I'll not begrudge you a scrap or two, but keep in mind that I'm the one who must listen to their whining afterward. Do spare my ears and don't pester them in future.
I have heard that you requisitioned supplies from my peasants at {s51}. I am sure that you would not have not done so had you not needed supplies urgently.
I understand you plundered {s51}. Try it again, and see what happens.
You have raided caravans in my demesne. This offense will earn you and your band of brigands a tryst with the hangman before you're much older.
Ho there, scoundrel! You accosted caravans traveling under my protection, bearing my sigil. You will cease this robbery immediately!
The Elder of {s51} told me you helped them when they were in need. I must admit, I've neglected my duties as lord, so I greatly appreciate your aid to them.

I heard that you gave charity to my tenants in the village of {s51}. I appreciate your efforts, but remember that it's my duty to protect and help them. Please refrain from undermining my authority in future.
My peasants in {s51} hold you in high esteem for what you have done for them. Times are hard, and I assume that you meant well, so I will not object to your assistance - this time.
I understand you gave charity to my peasants in the village of {s51}. As amusing as it is to picture you groveling for favor amongst my peasants, I ask that you mind your own business in future.

The people of {s51} sing your praises. As their rightful lord and master it is my duty to assist them in times of hardship. You may mean well, but your actions undermine my authority. In future, mind your own business, {reg63?sir:madam}.

I hear you recently assisted my peasants at {s51}. Times have been better, the gods know, and I suppose you meant well, but do not make a habit of it. I am still their lord and protector, and they should ask help from me, not passing strangers.
You won't regret your decision to give {s51} to me. You can count on me to protect it.
Reports arrived that you besieged and took {s51}. That was an impressive victory and I am proud to call you friend!

My Castellan reported that you took {s51} by storm. Good work, {reg63?Sir:Madam}! Soon our banners will fly over all their fortresses and their gold rest in our treasuries. Their grieving widows will serve us wine and their daughters will warm our beds.
Rumor has it that you took {s51} by surprise and overwhelmed that plague-ridden garrison scarce able to defend itself. Well, every dog has his day. Enjoy yours while you can.
The report of your successful assault on {s51} just arrived. Despite our differences in the past, I offer you my congratulations.
Congratulations on taking {s51}. Now we have them on the run!

Insolent cur! You have something that belongs to me - {s51}. Be assured I'll force you to relinquish it. Afterwards, if I feel generous enough to spare your miserable life, you will rot in my dungeon.
I congratulate you for taking {s51} from me. Nonetheless, I hope you will give me the chance to win it back, as befits a {reg63?man:woman} of honor!
I am informed that you assaulted and took {s51}. I hope my dungeon is to your liking, as you will spend much time there in the years to come.

I suppose you'd like to drink to our victory over {s54}. Well, save your wine. It will take more than wine to wipe out the stain of your earlier disgraces. If I didn't hold the good of the kingdom higher than my grudge against you, I might well have joined ranks with the enemy!
The memory of the victory at {s54} warms my heart, but recollections of your past misdeeds outweigh my good memories.
That was a great victory over {s54}, wasn't it? We made his army a feast for the crows! Ha! He'll think twice before he fields an army against us again.
I won't forget how we whipped {s54}! I enjoyed that. The little prick deserved worse than defeat. Next time, I hope we kill him.
The gods be praised for our victory over {s54}! Let us bow our heads and pray we don't grow too proud and entreat the gods to continue to favor our cause.
Wasn't that an enjoyable defeat of {s54}? We cut through them like a reaper in a field of barley!
Don't suggest raising a toast to our success over {s51}. We may have fought together, but I don't drink with riffraff.
Our assault at {s51} is worth remembering, but other matters still lie between us.
My grandchildren's children will hear the tale of how we broke the walls of {s51} and put its defenders to the sword. It is a sweet memory!
Remember how the enemy squealed like stuck pigs, as we mounted the walls of {s51}? They thought themselves safe! We wiped the smug smiles of their faces and put cold fear into their hearts!
I congratulate you for our successful capture of {s51}. Let us once again give thanks to the gods and pray we keep their favor.
I won't forget how we captured {s51} together. It was an honor to fight at your side
Hold your toast, {reg63?Sir:Madam}. Your wine will turn sour, given the mischiefs you did me earlier. The memory of our joint fight at {s51} is much sweeter if I forget you were there.
Bah! I remember watching you in the battle of {s51}. My infant son could have done better with a paring knife.
The wound I took at {s51} has healed properly and is scarcely scarred. I should have seen that blow coming! Still, we broke through their lines and sent them running, eh? What a sweet memory, indeed.
That was a fine fight near {s51}. The bastards ran like Erida Occisor herself was after their hides! Too bad for them it was us instead.
I still remember how bravely you fought in the great battle near {s51}. Let us praise the gods and never forget that victories are achieved only with their favor.
Honored friend, I will not forget our battle at {s51}. It warms my heart to have fought by your side.
So, you crossed swords with that rascal, {s54}, and actually emerged victorious. I am very happy to hear that; it served him right.
A peddler told my captain of guard that you fought and defeated {s54}. Remember that day well, for it was a very lucky one for you!
I heard a rumor that you engaged and defeated that flea-ridden dog, {s54}. Ah, if only I could have heard him whimpering for mercy. I would have pissed myself laughing!
You had a great victory over {s54}. I hope there isn't anything to the rumor that treachery played a part in your victory.
In camp last night, I learned that you defeated {s54}. I hope you treated him chivalrously when you captured him.
Last time we met, I found your tactics equal to those of a seasoned commander. Therefore, I do not begrudge you your victory, but I wish to restore my good name. Let us test our strengths once more!
I have been looking forward to meeting you again, trickster. Your shifty little ruses will not deceive me a second time. I will relish hearing your cries for mercy once I've defeated you.
The last time we engaged one another, you had the better of me. However, {playername}, be assured that it will not happen again, for the gods favor my cause!
Back for more? Make me fight you again, and I'll feed your guts to my hounds, assuming they can stomach the reek of cowardice.
Come to test your valor against me again, {playername}? Are you sure you're equal to such an audacious challenge?
Once again you come at me? Will you never learn? Wasn't last time humiliating enough for you?
You are a persistent nuisance. I'll be rid of you as easily as I crush a louse.
How many times must I chastise you before you learn to keep your distance? You should beg the gods to knock some sense into that thick head of yours! If they don't oblige, I certainly will!
The last time I saw you, you had been struck down by the men of {s54}. The blame for that disaster is entirely yours and it's a pity you survived that debacle.
My men reported that you were captured and led off the battlefield by {s54}'s men. Got away, did you?
Bad luck that {s54}'s men struck you down back there, {playername}. Don't worry - we'll find him and make him choke on his victory.
I feared the worst when I saw you struck down by {s54}'s men. It is good to see you alive and well.
My steward told me last night that {s54} gave you a hard time. Don't worry, my friend - I'll track him down and make you a gift of his head.
When I heard reports of {s54} slaughtering your men like sheep, I laughed myself sick at the thought of your demise! Damnit, now you turn up alive. What a disappointment!
A fortnight ago I heard news that {s54} crushed you. Hah! Children should not meddle in games meant for grown-ups, little {reg63?boy:girl}!
The dozen men I hanged last week wore your colors. Given that {s54} scattered your forces all over Pendor, I suppose they were reduced to banditry. That is most disappointing...
Someone told me {s54} defeated you. No doubt your defeat was sent by the gods as punishment for your misdeeds, {playername}. I beg you, ask the gods to forgive your sins!

A couple of the lads from my fief, whom you enlisted, returned with the news that {s54} defeated you. Do try not to get too many of our men killed, won't you? Dead men can't harvest my grain or pay my taxes.
On my journey here, I heard the news that {s54} defeated you. Don't take it to heart - the tables will soon be turned!
{s54} told me you saved him from likely defeat. Whatever else I think of you, I must at least commend you for aiding him.
[relevance should be zero, and this message should not appear]
{s54} told me you rescued him from sure defeat and turned the battle in your favor. I appreciate such a noble and successful deed.
I heard that you rode to the rescue of our poor {s54}. Did you think him a damsel in distress? Quit fancying yourself a knight in shining armor - heroes always come to a bad end.
My castellan told me that you saved {s54} from a whipping. You should have left him to learn the lesson he richly deserves.
Reports claim that you helped {s54} out of a tight spot. That was a noble deed, {reg63?sir:madam}.
I heard that you got {s54} out of a tight spot. Good work! Our side needs more {reg63?men:women} who don't hesitate to intervene where needed!
You bloody little coward! You left us to face {s54} on our own, while you ran for your life! I'll spit upon your grave, as I spit in your face right now!
You abandoned me in the midst of the battle with {s54}. I'll see you stripped of your titles and land, and buried in a traitor's grave, you honorless turncoat.

You left me in the middle of the battle with {s54}, like a rat abandoning a sinking ship - I trust you have a good explanation. Were you shaking too much to hold your weapon? Did your teeth chatter too loudly for you to hear my commands? Well?

What happened to you in the middle of that battle against {s54}? I needed you to reinforce my men, and you just left. I hope it was because you were carried off the field badly wounded, for I would be ashamed to have gone into battle alongside a coward.
Why did you leave the battlefield just when I expected you to lead the charge into {s54}'s ranks? Were you wounded?
For the gods' sake, what happened? One moment you were fighting beside us against {s54}, and the next moment you were nowhere to be found! Where the hell did you go?
Last time we met, you ran from me like a whipped dog. Have you come back to snarl at me again or just to whine for mercy?
At our last encounter, you galloped off in the opposite direction. Learn to stand and fight like a true warrior!
When you fled from me, the last time we crossed swords, I had high hopes I'd never see you again.
Fleeing me was a wise decision, the last time ill luck led you to cross my path. Perhaps you should turn tail and run again, you sniveling coward.
You might have escaped the last time we crossed paths, but next time I'll not let you get away so easily!
Your enemies boast that you fled from {s54}, leaving your men behind to cover your retreat. I pray that is not true, for such behavior dishonors us all.

{s54} said you ran from him, leaving your men behind to buy your escape with their lives. Desperate times inspire desperate measures, but you'd best look to your good name. Men will not fight in our armies if they think we'll abandon them on the field of battle.
By the way, I hear you ran away from {s54} like a squeaking rat fleeing a terrier, leaving your men behind to be butchered. Hah! I'm damned sorry I missed that delightful sight!
Trickster! You may have bested {s54}, but you cannot defeat us all! I shall not be deceived by your clever little tricks!
Rumor has it that you were lucky enough to defeat {s54}. Ever since I heard that, I have wished to avenge him.
Your fame runs before you, {playername}. {s54} may have fallen for your tricks, but if you fight me, you'll find me a much more slippery foe.
I hear you defeated {s54}. I will be a truer test of your skill at arms, since only sheer luck can give you victory over me.
I understand you were able to capture {s54}. I hope you squeezed him for every denar in his treasury.
I heard that you captured {s54}. Your coffers must be well-filled with ransom by now. Too bad that money alone cannot transform a low-born cur into a {reg63?gentleman:gentlewoman}!
Rumor has it that you managed to capture {s54}. Well done! I trust you treated him with the courtesy due his rank?
So you captured that old scalawag, {s54}? Despite the fact that he's a worthless piece of dung, his ransom should bring a pretty penny, given his rank and title.
It came to my ears that you captured {s54}, but then let him go. Such chivalry is laudable.
I had a report that you captured {s54}, but released him without a ransom. Your action was honorable, but also rather stupid.
I heard whispers that you captured {s54}, but allowed him to go free, which was certainly most chivalrous of you. You may wish to keep in mind that chivalry does not win wars.
So you were able to get your hands on {s54}. Why did you let him go? How very chivalrous of you! No doubt the widows and orphans he'll leave in his wake will want to thank you in person.
Funnily enough, I heard that you captured {s54}, then released him without ransom. Well, I won't advise you on how to treat your prisoners, but you'd have done better to keep him under guard.

You had me at your mercy, yet allowed me to go free when I was unlucky enough to fall into your hands. I hope you enjoyed toying with me as a cat plays with a mouse. Soon I will have you at my mercy, to slay or humiliate according to my fancy.

Despite my capture, you did not take advantage of the situation to enrich yourself, and allowed me an honorable leave. That was kind of you, and I will not forget it. Still, I must remember and keep the oath I gave to my liege, and our kingdoms are still at war.
You were very stupid to allow me to go free when you captured me. We remain enemies, and I cannot promise to repay your mercy in kind.
I thank you for sparing me humiliation and the payment of a hefty ransom when you had me at your mercy. That was kind of you, but we are still at war, and must remain enemies.

You released me when you had the better of me and I was unlucky enough to fall into your hands. That was kind of you and I am glad that our kingdoms no longer war against one another. I may be able to repay that debt now.
My liege lord, {s54}, sent a messenger saying you had joined our cause. I trust you'll not disgrace us by behaving in a cowardly fashion.
The King sent a runner with the news of your pledge of fealty. I look forward to fighting alongside you against our foes. Together, we will crush them.
Hmmpf... I heard that you pledged allegiance to our lord, {s54}. Bah. Do yourself a favor and stay out of my way.
I hear you swore allegiance to {s54} and were rewarded for your fealty. Fight hard against our foes but respect your betters. Most importantly, don't annoy me and we'll get along fine.
So {s54} accepted your pledge of fealty. Were I in his place, I would not trust you to clean the jakes.

I was informed that you pledged fealty to our lord, {s54}. Fight bravely and you will be well-rewarded. Betray us and we'll make a sufficiently fine example of you that future oathbreakers will think twice before betraying us.

I heard that you joined our cause and {s54} took your oath. I do not pretend to be happy about his decision, but perhaps it is better to have you inside our tent pissing out, rather than outside pissing in.
My lord {s54} tells me you pledged yourself to him. That is good. The more skilled fighters we have with us in these troubled times, the better  though I will watch your progress closely.
I was told you swore yourself to {s54}. No doubt you will soon betray him and I will have the pleasure of seeing you charged with high treason. I will savor watching you hanged, drawn and quartered.

{reg63?Sir:Madam} - I heard that you swore an oath of fealty to {s54}. Excellent! I am sure that you and I will become very good friends. Betray us, however, and you'll face deadly consequences. You will quickly regret such a huge mistake.

I was informed you pledged yourself to our lord, {s54}. Well, I can't say that I would have trusted you that much, but perhaps you deserve the benefit of the doubt. I hope you'll prove yourself worthy of his trust.
{s54}, sent news he had accepted your oath of allegiance. Good {reg63?man:woman}! Our lord is generous, and rewards loyalty and valor.
News is that you pledged yourself a vassal to {s54}. Alas, from what I know of you, you will disgrace our side quite shortly. Mind you, I'll not complain if you prove me wrong.
I heard you gave an oath of vassalage to {s54}. Fight our foes with valor, but retain your honor and compassion! A good name is as valuable as a sharp sword or a well-bred destrier.
I heard that {s54} granted you the fief of {s51}. Don't forget - spare the whip and spoil the peasant! Without good discipline, they've a tendency to get uppity.

News arrived that {s54} granted you {s51}. I am glad to see you prosper - but be careful. Men grow covetous of their neighbors' wealth and will plot to do them a mischief. If you stay close to me, I'll watch your back.
I was pleased to hear that {s54} granted you {s51}. May your new lands prosper and bring you great wealth.
I wasn't overly pleased that {s54} granted you the fief of {s51}. Keep in mind that pride ever goes before a fall.

It seems fortune favored you when {s54} granted you the fief of {s51}. I suspect, however, that fate has raised you up merely to humble you the more when you fall. It will be a pleasure to see you thrown back onto your dungheap.
So {s54} has assigned you the fiefdom of {s51}? Let's hope you merit his generosity.
I heard that {s54} granted you {s51}. You seem to be doing very well for yourself. Continue as you have done, and you might advance further.
I cannot believe you renounced your allegiance to {s54}! It grieves me that we must now meet as enemies.
I was quite concerned to hear you renounced your oath to our liege, {s54}. Let us pray that we do not come to blows.
I always had you figured as a traitor to {s54}, and now it seems that I was right! I hope you are brave enough to face your trial and execution for high treason with fortitude.
I was disgusted to hear that you renounced your allegiance to {s54}. I am now forced to consider you a traitor and treat you accordingly.
I heard that you decided to serve another master, rather than {s54}. Well, I suppose it's the way of the world for old comrades to become enemies. A pity.
Renouncing your oath of fealty to {s54} wasn't a smart move at all, {reg63?Sir:Madam}. Well, it's none of my concern and entirely your decision, but do not expect me to spare you when next we meet.
My informants tell me that some people in this realm are speaking of you as the next king. I assume that you will quickly put a stop to such idle and dangerous talk.
My informants tell me that some of your companions have telling the peasants that you have a claim to the throne. I sincerely hope that they have been acting without your orders.
It is well known that I had quarreled with {s54}, and {s50} ruled in my rival's favor.
It is well known that I had protested {s54}'s decision to appoint {s51} as marshal.
It is well known that I am dissatisfied with {s54} for the favor shown to {s51}, who led us to defeat against the {s56}.
It is well known that I am disappointed that {s54} received the fief of {s51}, which should have gone to me.
It is well known that {s51} paid suit to {s54}, while I was also courting her. He is unworthy of her attentions, and I intend to teach him to keep his distance from her.
I hear that you have been paying suit to {s54}. I do not believe that you are worthy of a fair lady such as her, and would strongly encourage you to cease pursuing her.

I hear that you have been paying suit to {s54}. Let me tell you something -- I've had my eye on that one ever since I was a lad, and she was a lass. She's a high-born lady of this realm, and should not be demeaned by a foreigner's crude attentions. Keep away from her, or expect to pay the price!
I followed your suggestion, and profited much by your advice.
I followed your suggestion and met with disaster, and I hold you responsible.

I understand that you have given {s51} to a commoner who calls himself {s54}. Be careful. To learn the art of governance is no easy task, and perhaps it is best that fathers pass it on to their sons. I advise you against tampering with the institution of lordship.
I understand that you have given {s51} to a commoner who calls himself {s54}. Do not the ancients warn us against making royal robes out of the hides of pigs?
I understand that you have given {s51} to a commoner who has taken the name of {s54}. Have a care! A dog may turn on its master.
Congratulations on your marriage to my {s11} {s50}. You may now consider yourself part of the family!
Congratulations on your marriage to {s50}. The news does credit to you both.
Well -- I see that you have married {s50}. She was always a silly girl, with appalling judgment.
Well... You somehow persuaded my {s11} {s50} to marry you. I don't know what you did to make her accept you, but our family will not forget this humiliation.
I hear that you have eloped with {s50}, against her family's wishes. I am not pleased. Her family are among the great lords of my realm, and I do not like to see them made to look like fools.

I hear that you have broken my truce by attacking {s55}. Do you know how this makes me look? If you were acting under my orders, I appear dishonorable. If you were not, I look weak. I have half a mind to indict you for treason here and now.
I hear that you have attacked subjects of the {s55}. You have given them an excuse to attack me, if they want... We shall see what comes of this. A fine day's work you have done!
liege
martial
bad-tempered
pitiless
cunning
sadistic
good-natured
upstanding
roguish
benevolent
mercantile
Choose your fate - yield or die!
The odds are not in your favor today. You may fight us, but there is no shame if you yield to us, either.
I have you cornered. Give up, or I'll ride you down like the dog you are.
You cannot defeat me and I'll teach you a painful lesson if you dare to try. Yield or perish!
You are outmatched today. Give up - if not for your own sake, then for that of your men! Your arrogance will bring them only death.
Surrender quickly or I'll dismember you, very slowly.
We have the advantage of you, {reg63?Sir:Madam}. Yield and I pledge my word that you will be well-treated.
You can fight us, but many of your men will be killed, and you will probably lose. Yield, and spare both our men unnecessary bloodshed.
Stop! I yield! Put down your weapon! I yield!
I yield! I yield! Stop! I yield!
Enough of this! You win today! Ah, the shame of it!
I yield! You have won. Cursed be this damnable day!
Hold! Stop! I yield to you!
I give up! I give up! Call off your dogs! I yield!
Congratulations on your victory, {reg63?Sir:Madam}. Accept my sword, I yield to you.
I yield! Do yourself credit, and grant me the honors of war, as befitting my rank!
That may be, but I wish to fight with you
That may be, but it is my duty to fight with you
Hah! I want to fight with you
Why should I care? I wish to fight with you
Ah. Unfortunately, you see, I wish to fight with you
Still your tongue! You will have need of it shortly, while begging for mercy
I'm sorry -- I can't just let you ride away. No hard feelings?
That may be, but my duty to my liege requires me to fight with you
Finally I'm free again! You have my gratitude, {reg63?Sir:Madam}. I shall not forget your kindness.
Thank you, {reg63?Sir:Madam}! You are indeed a {reg63?man:woman} of honor. I shall not forget your act of chivalry!
I'm free? Well... Goodbye, then.
I appreciate that. When you are finally defeated I will request that your death be swift and merciful. Unless you'd care to join us?
Am I? Really? You are a good {reg63?man:woman}. I will  find a way to repay you one day.
Am I? So refined is your cruelty that you would rather see me free and humiliated than in chains? Enjoy your triumph! I hope you choke on it!
You are indeed a {reg63?man:woman} of honor, {reg63?Sir:Madam}. I shall not forget your kindness!
The tales are true - you are indeed a {reg63?man:woman} of honor, {reg63?Sir:Madam}. I shall not forget this day!
Who are you, who dares to come in arms against me?
What is your name, {reg63?Sir:Madam}? It will be needed for your grave marker.
And who in the seven hells are you?
Who are you? Speak, so that I may name the one I slay.
Please tell me your name. It is always good to know the enemy.
Who are you? Speak quickly, before I cut your tongue out.
May I know your name, {reg63?Sir:Madam}? If we are to come to blows I should like to know who you are.
Now, who are you, who comes in arms to against me?
Today you have proven yourself an excellent ally.
There is no greater fortune than the chance to show one's prowess on the field of battle!
Hah! We showed those bastards a thing or two, didn't we?
Together, we will make the foe learn to fear our names.
We must press our advantage, {reg63?Sir:Madam}, so the blood shed today is not wasted, but well-spent for victory.
Time to strip their dead and round up the wounded. The crows will feast on the dead and all will know the fate of those who come against us.
Wasn't that a good scrap! There's no joy like the joy of victory, eh?
Now let us give thanks to the gods for our victory and mourn the many fine men who fell today. May their souls rest in peace.
You turned the tide out there on the field today. Whatever I may think of you, I cannot fault you for your valor.
{playername} - you have shown yourself a worthy {reg63?man:woman} today, whatever your misdeeds in the past.
Hmmph. Yours is not a face I like to see but I suppose I must thank you for your help.
Your help out there was most valuable, {playername}. I don't imagine that you came to help me out of kindness, yet I thank you.
It would be impolite not to thank you for rushing to aid me in my hour of need. So... thank you.
Well! How touching! {playername} has come to rescue me. Who'd have thought that would happen?
{playername}! We've had our fair share of quarrels in the past, but you fought well today. My thanks to you!
Perhaps I was wrong about you. Your arrival was most timely. You have my gratitude, {reg63?Sir:Madam}.
So you're here. Well, better late than never, I suppose.
We have had harsh words in the past, but let us enjoy our victory and forget them for the moment.
If you're waiting for thanks, don't hold your breath. Your help wasn't needed and I assume you joined us only because you had nothing better to do.
You arrive like a jackal to a lion's kill. Very well, help yourself to the spoils of my victory. I shall not stop you.
{playername}... Well, I suppose your arrival didn't hurt, although I won't pretend I'm happy to see you.
Back off, you greedy vulture! This was my victory, however hard you try to steal the glory for yourself.
Oh, it's you, {playername}. Well, I suppose I should thank you for your help - thank you.
Thank you for coming to my support. Now I'd best be off before I say something discourteous.
I need someone like you to knock them into shape.
They need someone to show them the meaning of valor.
Fat,lazy bastards. In their current state, they're worthless.
They are more afraid of the enemy than they are of me, and that is unacceptable.
Men, like steel, are tempered and hardened in fire.
I need someone to flog some courage into those cowards, or kill them trying.
They're good enough lads but I am afraid that they're not quite ready for a battle yet.
It would be tantamount to murder to lead them into combat in their current state. Please see to it.
What? Why do you attack us? Speak, you rascal, quickly!
I have no objection to a trial of arms, but I'd like to know your reason for attacking us.
You're making a big mistake, {reg63?boy:girl}. What the hell do you think you're playing at?
Indeed? If you really want to die today, I'll be more than happy to oblige you. I am curious as to what you hope to accomplish by throwing your life away.
Really? I think that you are acting most unwisely. What do you hope to gain by this ridiculous challenge?
What's this? Do you want all your men slaughtered? If so, I'll gladly oblige you.
Why do you challenge me? We've no quarrel, {reg63?Sir:Madam}, nor any reason for one - yet.
I consider this an unprovoked assault and will protest to your King. What is the meaning of this?
I will not hesitate to cut you down if need arises. But I offer you the chance to ride away now.
I am eager to take up your challenge, {reg63?Sir:Madam}, although I will give you a minute to reconsider it.
Bah! I'm in no mood for this nonsense today. Get out of my way.
Since I'm in a merciful mood today, I'll pretend I did not hear you.
I don't see what you hope to gain by making an enemy out of me. Perhaps you should reconsider your words.
I have no time to waste on you. Give way and crawl back into your hole.
I don't see what you could possibly gain by picking this fight, {reg63?Sir:Madam}. Leave now, and live to see another day.
If a fight is what you wish, {reg63?Sir:Madam}, a fight you shall have. Still, I offer you the chance to back down and leave peacefully.
As you wish. Prepare to die!
So be it. Defend yourself!
You impudent whelp! I'll crush you!
If you wish to die so badly, I have no choice but to oblige you.
Well, since you leave me no choice...
You impudent dog! I'll make you curse the day your mother whelped you!
Very well, I had hoped that we might avoid coming to blows but I see that I have no choice in the matter.
So be it. It saddens me that you will not listen to reason.
Well, I am very disappointed in you. But I am sure that you will have other chances to redeem yourself.
There is no honor in failing a quest, but I will accept your word that you tried.
You failed? Bah! I should have expected as much from the likes of you.
You failed? You disappoint me, which is most unwise. Those who disappoint me seldom live long
Well, I am disappointed, but no one can guarantee that the winds of fortune will always blow their way.
Indeed? Those who fail me generally do not live to regret it.
Oh well, it was a long shot, at best. Thank you for trying.
So be it. I am sure that you gave it your best effort.
Follow you? You forget your station, {reg63?Sir:Madam}.
On the day you prove yourself a true warrior, I may consider following you. But not today.
Follow someone like you? I don't think so.
Lords do not follow commoners, {reg63?Sir:Madam}.
First demonstrate that you will not lead me into disaster. Then, I may consider following you.
I think not! Those of your station follow those of mine, rather than the reverse.
Uhmm, no. I am a bit pressed for time just now. Perhaps at a later date.
Prove you're worth your salt as a leader before you request that I follow you.
base varlot
dishonorable knave
filth-swilling bastard
low-born worm
careless oaf
sniveling cur
unpleasant fellow
disgraceful scoundrel
base and vile
bullheaded
quarrelsome and divisive
cruel, tyrannical
unscrupulous and manipulative
vile and dishonorable
hopelessly naive
stiffnecked and sanctimonious
bring us to ruin
attack the enemy without thought or plan, and throw away the lives of your men
pick fights with other lords, leaving us divided and weak
alienate the commons, provoking revolt and mutiny
cut a deal with the enemy behind our back
bring shame upon our cause and our realm
take pity on our enemies, rather than fight them
place your own exaggerated sense of honor above the needs of the realm
[liege]
{s45} was clearly wronged. Although I gave my oath to {s46}, it does not bind me to support him if he usurped the throne illegally.
Hmm. {s46} has never given me my due, hence I don't owe him much. However, {s45} will be no better, and {s46} has shown himself a leader, at least.
Hmm. {s45} says {reg3?she:he} is the rightful heir to the throne. That is good - it absolves me of my oath to {s46}. Still, I must weigh my decision carefully.
Hmm. I gave an oath of fealty to {s46}, yet the highborn are not bound by their oaths as are ordinary people. Our highest duty is to bring order and and justice to our people.
Hmm. In this mercenary world, a wise man must think of himself, for no one else will. So - what's in it for me?
I do not know what to say. I gave an oath to {s46} as my lawful ruler. But... if he is not the lawful ruler, I don't know whether I am still oathbound or not.

This is troublesome. It is a grave thing to declare my fealty to {s46} null and void, to dissolve the bonds which keep our land from sinking into anarchy. Yet I am pledged to support the legitimacy of the succession to the throne as well, and {s45} holds a valid claim.
[liege]
On the other hand, {s46} has led us in war and peace and I am reluctant to renounce my allegiance, for he leads us well.
Do tell me, why should I turn my back on the devil I know in favor of the devil I don't know?

It is a most perilous position, and the question of whom I would make {reg3?ruler:king} of this land needs careful attention. Yet this presents an opportunity as well, and I may reap many rewards if I choose correctly.

{s46} has been challenged and thus will never be able to rule as strongly as one whose claim is unquestioned. Yet if {s45} takes the throne by force, {reg3?she:he} will not be as well-supported nor be as strong as one who succeeded peacefully.
Perhaps if I join {s45} while {reg3?she:he} is still weak {reg3?she:he} will enrich me. On the other hand, if I bring {s46} your head, he will reward me with a large sum as well.
{s46} has always treated me decently, yet he did wrong {s45}. I hesitate to renounce my fealty to {s46}, but my heart tells me I must not support injustice.
I feel that I must do whatever is best for the realm, to keep it from being ravaged by civil war or torn apart by its enemies.
My sword is at the disposal of my rightful liege, so long as he upholds his duty to me.
Bah. They're all a bunch of bastards. I try to make sure that the ones who wrong me learn to regret it.
Men will always try to cheat others of their rightful due. In this faithless world, each must remain vigilant of his own rights.
Well, it's a harsh world, and it is our lot to face harsh choices. Sometimes one must serve a tyrant to keep the peace, but sometimes a bit of rebellion keeps the kings honest. Circumstance is all.
My philosophy is simple: it is better to be the wolf than the lamb.
Well, you should keep faith with your promises, and not do injustice to others. Sometimes it's hard to balance those. Stick with people you trust, I think, and it's hard to go far wrong.
Kingship and lordship have been instituted to keep the peace and prevent the war of all against all, yet that must not blind us to the possibility of injustice.
Hmm... I guess I'm thinking that it's good to be a lord.
A good ruler makes sure all are treated justly. Personally, I intend to use my authority to better the lot of those who live in my demesne.
A good ruler creates the proper conditions for people to prosper. Personally, I intend to use my wealth to create more wealth, for myself and for the common benefit.
I have already heard some arguments for supporting your candidate for the throne and I tend to agree with them.
I have heard some quite convincing arguments for supporting your candidate so far and I tend to agree. We'll have a new {reg63?King:Queen}.
So far only weak arguments for supporting your candidate have come to my ears. I do not find those reasons convincing at all.
Anyone begging for support, employing such weak arguments as yours, is bound to fail, especially when discussing the royal succession.
{s49} your ally {s44} once questioned my honor and bravery. I've hoped for the chance to cast his slanders in his teeth!
{s49} you're working with {s44}. He's a shifty fellow and I don't trust him one bit.
{s49} you seem to have enlisted {s44}, who is soft, weak and unfit to govern the most paltry fief. I have always detested the creature.
{s49} {s44}, who has already joined you, is headstrong, quarrelsome and will assuredly prove a liability to your cause.
{s49} I have no desire to fight alongside your ally, {s44}. His nauseating displays of virtue revolt me.
{s49} I'd be reluctant to be on the same side as {s44}, who has quite a reputation for cruelty.
{s49} your ally, {s44}, is a dangerous, unreliable, and highly unprincipled man. I despise him.
I respect your line of argument.
To be frank, I find your arguments compelling.
I haven't heard a less convincing line of argument since my sire's father died.
you eloquently state your case.
you make a reasonable case.
you have failed to make your case in a convincing manner.
I hold you in great respect.
I know and respect you as highly as I esteem your cause.
I do not know you as well as I would like. I must consider, before making such a decision.
I do not trust you. Enough said, begone.
Furthermore,
However,
, and
, but
. Moreover,
. Nonetheless,
I have decided to support {s45} as the rightful heir.
Ahh, I've thought long enough. I never did like {s46} much anyway. Let's take his throne and give it to someone more appealing.
You are fortunate indeed. I have decided to join your cause. Please do not give me reason to regret my decision.
This is a most dangerous decision, but after careful consideration I have decided to join you. Let's hope everything turns out well.
I have decided to back your {reg3?woman:man} {s45}. You'd best make sure that {reg3?she:he} rewards me well or you'll curse the day I joined you!
I think your {reg3?woman:man} will be a good and worthy ruler. I'll join you.
So be it. My first and foremost duty is to this realm. To save it from lawlessness I will back {s45} and renounce my homage to {s46}. May the gods forgive me if I do wrong.
Sorry, {s45} may have a good claim but it's not enough for me to turn my back on {s46}. I remain loyal to my liege and will fight his enemies wherever I encounter them.
Your whelp {s45} doesn't have what it takes to rule this realm. I'm sticking with {s46}.
Now is not the time to talk politics! Today I am accompanied by my fellow lords and armed for battle. You'd do better to prepare to fight, rather than wasting your time on useless words.
Do you expect me to discuss betrayal of my liege while we are surrounded by his army? What do you take me for, a bloody idiot?
Hold your tongue! Whatever I may have to say on this matter will not be said here, in the midst of our army.
This is hardly the time or the place for such a discussion. Perhaps we can talk about this matter at a later time and in a different place, but for now we still are foes.
You should have your mouth sewn shut! Imagine what will happen if the other vassals see me talking to you about committing high treason!
So you wish to discuss your rebellion with me? Try again, when we aren't surrounded by my liege's army, and I may decide to listen.

Whatever my thoughts on the legitimacy of the succession, I am not willing to discuss them here and now. If we meet again and can speak in privacy, I will hear what you have to say on the matter. For now, consider me your enemy.
The gossip is that {s6} doesn't like anyone but himself.
A neighbor has heard that {s6} admires his appearance greatly. He ordered his knights to polish their armors brightly enough for him to see his own reflection.
A tavern drunk said that {s6} eats so much garlic that he must employ retainers without a sense of smell.
I heard the gossip is that the local girls fear {s6}, not for their virtue, but that he will steal their dresses and undergarments.
I was told that {s6} once mounted his knights on cows, after someone stole his horses. His mooing warband actually won an engagement! He is now known as the cowherd knight!
My brother understands that {s6} is so paranoid that he has a personal spy watching him lest he attempt to form a plot against himself.
A neighbor said his steward says that {s6} is quite a loner. He seldom talks with even his best friends, thus no one really knows him.
I heard that {s6} is so fearful after that last assassination attempt that he ordered his guards to attack anyone, lord or peasant, who gets too close to him!
A town guard says the gossip is that {s6} loves music so much that he sings for his men, and even convinced two young knights join his concert during a festival.
I heard {s6} is looking for someone to teach him the Noldor language, so he can insult them properly during their next engagement.
I heard that those who serve under {s6} say he is greatly enamored of his own good looks, and constantly buys new helmets because of his fear of facial scars.
Someone said that {s6} is a heavy drinker who bears no love for warfare, and often after a battle holes up in his castle to enjoy a solitary drink.

A tavern drunk said that a soldier once told him that {s6} crossed a great river alone, when his army refused to attempt it. He wanted to prove that obstacles can be overcome by willpower. After he crossed, his shamed men followed.
I heard that {s6} loves nothing more than war, because he cannot perform as a man except on a battlefield.

A town guard said that {s6} sometimes whistles while speaking. People say that {s6} visits taverns, not for drinks and good company, but rather to fight. He lost several teeth brawling, hence his whistled words.

A neighbor said that tavern gossips say that {s6} once rode up to a large band of the Order of the Dragon and proceeded to challenge the lot to a duel. He was left minus one eye, half a leg and seven fingers, but he is admired by the Order for his bravery. Or his stupidity, perhaps!
My sister told me about that 'wife' of {s6}'s. He married a scarred-up Mystmountain barbarian, supposedly because he prefers rough trade to real women.
I heard that {s6} broke his arm in a wrestling contest with a berserker. Now, after beating him, his opponent is now his most trusted friend.
I heard that even women in the fief of {s6} are required to attend weekly archery practice.
I heard that {s6} lost his balls in a duel in his youth. Left him with a maiden's voice! He has dedicated his life to the art of war, since he could not sire an heir, poor sod.
I heard that {s6}, despite being surrounded by Noldors, managed not only to defeat them, but also personally killed at least five.
I once heard that {s6} is very prone to outbursts of anger when faced with the possibility of defeat. His anger frequently leads him to victory!
I heard a mercenary say that, despite begin a good strategist, {s6} often chooses poor commanders unable to execute his complex plans, and thus comes to ruin.
I heard people say that the secret to the victories {s6} achieves is his collection of old military treatises from strategists of the old Kingdom of Pendor.
I heard that {s6} is a very conservative man. In battle, he will use only old tried and true tactics, despite what his officers advise.
My brother says the word is that, during a siege, {s6} raced up the ladder to open a breach for his men to storm the castle.

A town guard told me about the time {s6} besieged a castle in his younger days. His commander was killed. The young lord donned the bloody armor his commander no longer needed and took control of the siege. He ordered a night attack, which took the castle off guard. He won the siege but lost an eye in the battle.

A town guard said that {s6} almost came to blows with another lord lately because the man made a joke about his nose. If you ever talk to him, best avoid mention of eagles, hawks, ducks, or anything else with a beak.
I was told that {s6} has been banned from all Pendorian debating societies for arguing too vehemently, and drawing his blade!
A neighbor said he once woke up to hear {s6} having a shouting match with a rooster. The strange thing was that he actually won!
My sister said that rumor has it {s6} once bit a dog who had bitten him. Puts new meaning into the term 'hair of the dog,' heh, heh.
I was told that {s6} is just as likely to lose his temper daily as that the sun will rise tomorrow morning.
Someone said that {s6} keeps a philosopher in his hall to guarantee himself a good debate every day.
My brother once heard {s6} complain about the excessive fixation people have with the old days. He thinks the best times are now, and he will offer passionate debate to anyone who states otherwise.
A tavern drunk said {s6} often complains that he has yet to meet someone who can offer him a good challenge. He regularly annoys the knights he meets in his crusade to find his equal at combat.

A neighbor said he once woke in the middle of night to the sound of {s6} bellowing to some unfortunate officer that he refuses to use cowardly tactics such as an ambush. He prefers to face enemies head on.
Someone said a merchant told him that he saw {s6} inform a young lady that her dress did not match her shoes and her hat was unfashionable for this season.
I heard from a Knight that ever since {s6} was cheated by a merchant, he shows them no mercy. Still, who knows exactly what the merchant did...?

My brother said that bastard {s6} managed to turn a diplomatic mission into a war! The king was late to the meeting where he was to present the peace treaty, so {s6} mouthed off to one of the king's guards while he waited. When the king arrived, he flung some choice insults at him, as well. That was the end of the peace offer!
I heard that {s6} executed a squire for killing a deer in his preserve. I fear the poachers hunting in his forests will bring down vengeance upon their villages.
A town guard said he had seen the sheriffs of {s6}, and claims they are equipped as well as the Knights of the Lion.
I heard that {s6} once forced a father to execute his own daughter for adultery.
A neighbor said a good friend told him that {s6} will carry out any sentence he thinks just, and says if his justicar will not order proper punishment, he'll do it himself.
I heard that {s6} was once a Knight of the Dawn before coming into his inheritance.

My brother said that {s6} once acquitted a man for murder. The plaintiff had stood on one leg and shot an arrow at the apple he placed on the victim's head. {s6} let him off because of some obscure law legalizing this particular scenario.
I heard that {s6} automatically hangs any man in his army who deserts his post.

I heard from a friend that {s6} spends an unhealthy amount of time writing and enacting new laws. Those who serve him complain that they can only sleep when he is occupied with his studies or writing.

My sister said she refused to believe that {s6} once ordered an artist to create a lot of portraits of him and then distributed them to all the taverns in his fief. Having a mug of ale with your lord's image glaring down at you must be quite disturbing!

The rumor is that {s6} is looking for a new way to mark time. He theorizes that he could get more work out of his peasants if he can regulate time. Heh, next he'll try telling the sun when it should rise!
My brother says {s6} must have had a weasel in his ancestry, as he is a very cunning opponent.
